content.webTitle: Viswanath in charge of Sri Lanka series

fields.headline: Viswanath in charge of Sri Lanka series
fields.bodyText: Gundappa Viswanath, Mike Procter and Clive Lloyd will referee England's home Test and one-day series against Sri Lanka and India this summer. India's Viswanath will be in charge of the three-Test England v Sri Lanka series in May and June, the International Cricket Council said yesterday. The umpires will be Srinivas Venkataraghavan, also of India, and Daryl Harper of Australia (Lord's and Edgbaston) and Steve Bucknor of West Indies and South Africa's David Orchard (Old Trafford). Bucknor and Orchard will stay on for the one-day series, which will mark the South African Procter's first appearance in England as a member of the new five-man referees' panel. Lloyd will referee the England v India Test series, while the umpires for the four-Test series in July, August and September will be South Africa's Rudi Koertzen and Russell Tiffin of Zimbabwe (Lord's and Trent Bridge) and Asoka De Silva of Sri Lanka and Orchard (Headingley and the Oval). In the County Championship Second Division, Middlesex's Andrew Strauss clocked the first half-century of the new campaign against Durham before being dismissed for 70. He had put on 103 for the opening wicket with Sven Koenig, who went on to score exactly 100. At the close Middlesex stood on 326 for eight. At Cardiff, Glamorgan's Simon Jones claimed six for 45 as Derbyshire were skittled out for 217 at Cardiff. At the close Glamorgan were also struggling on 163 for eight. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
